message_1: What is the slope of the line passing through the points (-2, 4) and (3, 7)?
message_2:
To find the slope of the line passing through the points (-2, 4) and (3, 7), we can use the formula:

slope (m) = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1)

where (x1, y1) = (-2, 4) and (x2, y2) = (3, 7).

Plugging in the values, we get:

m = (7 - 4) / (3 - (-2))
m = 3 / 5

The slope of the line passing through the points (-2, 4) and (3, 7) is 3/5.
